page.title: Domestic responses to the 2011 Egyptian revolution

rev.diff:
Line 294: Line 294:
Many of [[Al-Azhar Mosque|Al-Azhar Imams]] joined the protesters on 30 January all over the country.<ref>{{verify credibility|date=February 2011|reason=what are credentials of "elaph publisher". seemingly has no wikipedia article. also, citation needs byline (or in absence of byline, addition of "staff writer" to "author" field).}} {{cite web|url=http://www.elaph.com/Web/arts/2011/1/628400.html|title=Ø®Ø§ÙØ¯ Ø§ÙØµØ§ÙÙ ÙÙÙØ¯ ÙØ¸Ø§ÙØ±Ø© ÙÙ ÙÙØ¯Ø§Ù Ø§ÙØªØ­Ø±ÙØ± |trans_title=''Khaled El Sawy Leads Demonstration in Tahrir Square''|language=[[Arabic language|Arabic]]|author=|date=2011-01-30|work=[[Elaph Publishing]]|accessdate=2011-02-01}}</ref>
Many of [[Al-Azhar Mosque|Al-Azhar Imams]] joined the protesters on 30 January all over the country.<ref>{{verify credibility|date=February 2011|reason=what are credentials of "elaph publisher". seemingly has no wikipedia article. also, citation needs byline (or in absence of byline, addition of "staff writer" to "author" field).}} {{cite web|url=http://www.elaph.com/Web/arts/2011/1/628400.html|title=Ø®Ø§ÙØ¯ Ø§ÙØµØ§ÙÙ ÙÙÙØ¯ ÙØ¸Ø§ÙØ±Ø© ÙÙ ÙÙØ¯Ø§Ù Ø§ÙØªØ­Ø±ÙØ± |trans_title=''Khaled El Sawy Leads Demonstration in Tahrir Square''|language=[[Arabic language|Arabic]]|author=|date=2011-01-30|work=[[Elaph Publishing]]|accessdate=2011-02-01}}</ref>
â
[[Coptic Orthodox Church of Alexandria|Coptic Orthodox]] Bishop Marcos of [[Shubra El-Khiema]] urged Christians not to join the demonstrations, saying that they do not know the goals of those responsible for launching the protests.<ref>{{Clarify|date=February 2011|reason=needs byline (or in absence of byline, "staff writer" dropped into the "author" field).}} {{cite web|url=http://www.almasry-alyoum.com/article2.aspx?ArticleID=285805&IssueID=2025|title=Ø§ÙÙÙØ§Ø¦Ø³ Ø§ÙÙØ³ÙØ­ÙØ© Ø§ÙØ«ÙØ§Ø« ØªØ±ÙØ¶ ÙØ¸Ø§ÙØ±Ø§Øª Ù¢Ù¥ ÙÙØ§ÙØ±.. ÙØªØ·Ø§ÙØ¨ Ø§ÙØ£ÙØ¨Ø§Ø· Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯Ù Ø§ÙÙØ´Ø§Ø±ÙØ©|trans_title=''At Three Demonstrations Christian Churches in Egypt Reject 25 January Protest; Ask Their Followers Not To Participate''|language=[[Arabic language|Arabic]]|author=|date=2011-01-24|work=[[Almasry Alyoum]]|accessdate=2011-02-01}}</ref> During his weekly sermon [[Pope Shenouda III]] asked his followers to be "calm" for the second day of demonstrations during his weekly sermon.<ref>{{verify credibility|date=February 2011|reason=what are credentials of this "youm7.com" source. seemingly has no wikipedia article. also, 1. citation needs byline (or in absence of byline, "staff writer" dropped into "author" field). also, 2. something funky about date (arabic characters in midst...seems to copy from source when copying numeric date).}} {{cite web|url=http://www.youm7.com/News.asp?NewsID=344449|title=ÙÙ Ø¹Ø¸ØªÙ Ø§ÙØ£Ø³Ø¨ÙØ¹ÙØ©.. Ø§ÙØ¨Ø§Ø¨Ø§ Ø´ÙÙØ¯Ø© ÙØ¯Ø¹Ù Ø§ÙØ¬ÙÙØ¹ ÙÙ"Ø§ÙØªÙØ¯Ø¦Ø©"|trans_title=''In Weekly Sermon, Pope Shenouda Calls for Calm''|language=[[Arabic language|Arabic]]|author=Ø¬ÙØ§Ù Ø¬Ø±Ø¬Ø³ Ø§ÙÙØ²Ø§Ø­Ù|date=2011-01-26|work=|publisher=[[youm7.com]]|accessdate=2011-01-29}}</ref> On 31 January, he expressed support for Mubarak in an interview with Egyptian state television.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052748703439504576116222399438428.html|title=Coptic Christians Worry About Future Without Mubarak |author=Champion, Marc|date=2011-02-01|work=[[The Wall Street Journal]]|accessdate=2011-02-04}}</ref> In spite of this, a number of young Christian activists joined the protests led by well-known Christians like member of the Wafd Party [[Raymond Lakah]]. [[Naguib Sawiris]], the head of [[Orascom Telecom]] said that the appointment of Omar Suleiman as vice president may not satisfy protestors. "I think it is not enough. It's a good step because the gentleman, Mr. Suleiman has a very good international reputation; he is from the system so he can at least ensure that the current transition to a more democratic regime can happen."<ref>Derhally, Massoud A. (30 January 2011). [http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-01-30/sawiris-says-suleiman-appointment-may-not-be-enough-to-end-egypt-protest.html "Sawiris Says Suleiman Appointment May 'Not Be Enough' to End Egypt Protest"]. ''[[Bloomberg]]''. Retrieved 1 February 2011.</ref> Coptic thinker{{Clarify|date=February 2011}} [[Rafiq Habib]] condemned the position of the church but he stressed that the participation of Copts in the demonstrations are increasing day by day.<ref>{{Clarify|date=February 2011|reason=needs byline (or in absence of byline, "staff writer" dropped into "author" field).}} {{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.net/NR/exeres/1049E146-447D-45F9-800E-7F2A064112E1.htm?GoogleStatID=9|title=Ø§ÙÙÙÙØ³Ø© Ø¨ÙÙØ£Ù Ø¹Ù ÙØ¸Ø§ÙØ±Ø§Øª ÙØµØ±|trans_title=''Church Stays Away from Protests in Egypt''|language=[[Arabic language|Arabic]]|author=|date=2011-01-27|work=[[Al Jazeera]]|accessdate=2011-01-29}}</ref>
+
[[Coptic Orthodox Church of Alexandria|Coptic Orthodox]] Bishop Marcos of [[Shubra El-Khiema]] urged Christians not to join the demonstrations, saying that they do not know the goals of those responsible for launching the protests.<ref>{{Clarify|date=February 2011|reason=needs byline (or in absence of byline, "staff writer" dropped into the "author" field).}} {{cite web|url=http://www.almasry-alyoum.com/article2.aspx?ArticleID=285805&IssueID=2025|title=Ø§ÙÙÙØ§Ø¦Ø³ Ø§ÙÙØ³ÙØ­ÙØ© Ø§ÙØ«ÙØ§Ø« ØªØ±ÙØ¶ ÙØ¸Ø§ÙØ±Ø§Øª Ù¢Ù¥ ÙÙØ§ÙØ±.. Ø§ÙØ¨Ø§Ø¨Ø§ Ø´ÙÙØ¯Ø© ÙØ¯Ø¹Ù Ø§ÙØ¬ÙÙØ¹ ÙÙ"Ø§ÙØªÙØ¯Ø¦Ø©"|trans_title=''In Weekly Sermon, Pope Shenouda Calls for Calm''|language=[[Arabic language|Arabic]]|author=Ø¬ÙØ§Ù Ø¬Ø±Ø¬Ø³ Ø§ÙÙØ²Ø§Ø­Ù|date=2011-01-26|work=|publisher=[[youm7.com]]|accessdate=2011-01-29}}</ref> On 31 January, he expressed support for Mubarak in an interview with Egyptian state television.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052748703439504576116222399438428.html|title=Coptic Christians Worry About Future Without Mubarak |author=Champion, Marc|date=2011-02-01|work=[[The Wall Street Journal]]|accessdate=2011-02-04}}</ref> In spite of this, a number of young Christian activists joined the protests led by well-known Christians like member of the Wafd Party [[Raymond Lakah]]. [[Naguib Sawiris]], the head of [[Orascom Telecom]] said that the appointment of Omar Suleiman as vice president may not satisfy protestors. "I think it is not enough. It's a good step because the gentleman, Mr. Suleiman has a very good international reputation; he is from the system so he can at least ensure that the current transition to a more democratic regime can happen."<ref>Derhally, Massoud A. (30 January 2011). [http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-01-30/sawiris-says-suleiman-appointment-may-not-be-enough-to-end-egypt-protest.html "Sawiris Says Suleiman Appointment May 'Not Be Enough' to End Egypt Protest"]. ''[[Bloomberg]]''.
